description: I like this app a lot. A lot of people say it doesn't work but it works fine on debian 12 (GNOME). There are some issues like if you star a task while the menu is open is crashes but other than that, it's a nice little todo app. I like that you can make multiple lists and archive them aswell. You can also change the color of the lists and it looks very nice. Checkout the help menu because it lists even more hidden features and how to use them.
It doesn't run on Fedora 40, opens up a blank full screen, which has no content at all
When I open it, all it shows is a grey screen. I recommend Done, another to-do manager, to people who run into this issue.
Nothing shows up on screen.
Like 40% of the comments, all i get is an empty window, grey
blank screen every time. ughhh.
I use To Do to keep track of things I want to accomplish and it serves my need for that well while looking beautiful at the same time.
summary: Nice and simple to do lists

description: No CalDAV support.

It has a great interface and is extremely simple to use. I use it with ownCloud and love it!
But:
- Has no support for repeating tasks
- Supports due dates, but not times
- No subtasks (though you can use "[ ] subtask" in comments
- Displays some regular calendars (ones without tasks)
summary: Another great Gnome design that's somewhat lacking on functionality

description: I used to store to-do notes in text files. No longer. This app is looks wonderful and works great. It lets you configure multiple lists, set deadlines for each task, and view what's coming due soon. It's pretty simple, but I can't think of anything missing, so that's no problem.

This, this is great! It is integrated well into GNOME 3, uses Wayland, has almost 0 bugs, and is just wonderful to use! take that, OS X Notes app! This app is much better than Bijiben (gnome 3 notes) and Mac OS X notes! Download it now!
I can't recommend this enough. It just works and works well. Fits in with the gnome desktop beautifully. Things seems to just work exactly like I expect every time I look for a feature.
It's a simple app and it does what it's been made for.
is this a bug? open it more than one day, and want to add today item , but it add to yesterday
summary: a good note for me, simple and practical

description:
I like the design and simplicity of the Gnome To Do App, but it's really annoying that written tasks are suddenly disappearing for no reason.
Every time I create a new list and fill it with several tasks and then close the list, the first few tasks I wrote are empty so that I need to rewrite the first tasks again.

I used this everyday to get things done. It is amazing. It syncs my calendars from Nextcloud which are integrated with Gnome and then creates lists from these calendars and as I add and update items it updates my nextcloud which syncs to my laptop running Gnome. Additionally, it syncs with DAVdroid on my phone. Great job Gnome team!

I just find it a pain to use and so I don't. That doesn't make it 1 star but if it works for you its good.

They seem to be working on improving it for the future and if they do I'll give it another shot then. Right now, just can't get into the current form of it.
Nice and simple . Not too much rubbish and complex stuff that no one uses .
a basic decent app where you can sync your notes thorugh different accounts if you want

good app, allows for everything I looking for in a todo app

Main issue, why I removed it: I cannot delete an old an unnecessary list. Every list I created afterwards, no Problem, but this list got stuck ans it annoys me so much if I cannot decide WHEN I delete WHAT. If I liked that kind of behavior I wouldn't migrate to Ubuntu and stay at Windows
summary: good app, simple, nothing to fancy

description: Even if I use GNOME Evolution to link to a CalDav server, I can't see my tasks in this application. I can sync it with Google or Microsoft, but not CalDav/WebDav. This is extraordinarily frustrating and makes the application useless to me. I spent days searching the web to try to figure this one out. I give up. Uninstall.
I try other similar apps and this surprise me. very very useful, simple, direct and efficient. congrats to developers!

Was a bit frustrated to find that this is one of the only GNOME apps in the Calendar/Contact suite that won't use the DAV server setup in Evolution. Hoping this comes in the future. Such a nice simple app.
Could be better if we can set recurring task
good for writing down a couple of tasks that you need to do in a day!
This is the To Do application that I've imagined it

The time I have used this little app, even tho it's super simple, only To Do lists, it does not reorder correctly, sometimes when you delete and undo, it duplicate tasks, and it keeps giving some kind of error when you r with a spotty internet connection.
thanks for sharing
It's really a very nice job.
Nice work and it syncs with my gmail..the best feature

One of the biggest problems with this app is that you cannot resize the text. That is the most annoying thing to me. Other than that, it's good, aside from a bug where it won't delete a list/task half the time. 

Gnome devs, please allow custom font sizes for this app! I don't have the best eyes, and it's hard for me to read tiny text!
summary: Okay app - needs a couple basic things

description: This is probably the best todo app I've found for the desktop. It syncs with Google Tasks, but there's no way to handle repeating tasks, I have to go to the Google interface for that. It is still a must have app for me.

GNOME To Do, along with GNOME Calendar and Contacts, will not work without GNOME Evolution as they all rely on Evolution's Exchange add-on, defeating their purpose.

I'd like to be able to just have To Do etc. without having to install Evolution - Calendar etc. should all be able to get the Exchange add-on for its self.
summary: Doesn't support Outlook without 'GNOME Evolution' installed

description: This software is very good looking but due to lacking integration of todoist, it remains useless in my case. Please think about integrating that for the thousands of users of todoist.
good app, simple, but how to open it by terminal
summary: good app, simple, but how to open it by terminal

description:
I finally found that there is an extension for todo.txt support.
Once enabled, adding lists to the file will create categories, and by using Syncthing I get everything synchronized on multiple devices.
One of those simple applications that helps you can change your life.

every thing works well. The app is useful because you can write down your

 to do things instead of stuffing them in your brain. Also you can write your

 thoughts and feelings in here.

I have been searching for an app to make to do list on a daily basis. It was right under my nose. I have not put it to full use as of yet, but it seems to work well for what I am attempting to do. Thank you! UBUNTU is gaining my confidence. I experimented a little with Elementary, but it just cant seem to do as much as UBUNTU. aBOUT TO CLEAN eLEMENTARY OFF MY LAPTOP AND INSTALL UBUNTU.

Tried adding a task but as soon as I go back one screen and come back again into the Personal tasks. There are 2 tasks.

After deleting a tasks they don't go away even after click "Clear Completed" ...

Even if I have a Todo task inside Lists it does not show up under Today.
An app that allows you to make to do lists. Simple, right? Well no, because you can't even delete an old list.
summary: Can't even perform the most basic of tasks

description: works flawless and does what you expect
I don't expect much more from a Todo list manager. Also, besides local storage, integrates with Google services, which is nice.

I love the minimalistic approach and would love to use the app
But it won't sync to my google tasks anymore and I am not allowed to delete certain list.

Please give it a sync now option
summary: Can not delete lists no correct syc to google

description: I need an export option so that at EOD I can send alll my todo to my boss , which i Can't do with this.
NOtm wotking on Ubuntu desktop
unscheduled and score extensions are not working though
summary: Very good, use it every day, synced with nextcloud

description: repeatedly lost my changes from previous day on Ubuntu 18.04

I set up Google via online accounts but couldn't sync tasks with it or create a to do list after having selected Google (as opposed to Personal) when creating a new task.

I created a Personal to do list, and then closed the app. When I re-opened it, the list was gone.

Don't see any clues after searching the web.
summary: Didn't save to do list; didn't connect to Google

description: best app )))))))
no sync via caldav, evolution cannot be replaced yet.
Wich app helps tp maintaine a routine
It's a simple, functional and outdated AF task manager
Please add specific time (hour) and reminder/notification feature please.
summary: Good enough, simple, sleek. Still need improvement though

description: It would be perfect if add a task property for assigning the task to someone.

i am unsure of syncing the notes via this app. so i am using my traditional 'To Do' of windows. please clarify so that i can use it with any fear of losing my notes after ubuntu ininstall-reinstall procedure.
summary: can it be synced across my ubuntu id

description: I had a problem re-ordering tasks didn't work (ubuntu 20) but fine other than that
As soon as you set to a second task a priority value the first one loss the assigned status. It's frustrating.
summary: I can't order the task for priority

description: It can schedule for only one day either today,tomorrow or another specific day. It will be great if it get feature like remind certain task every day or specific days and at certain time. Using it for a while Great app.
Tried it out. Sort doesn't work. Done.
ubuntu 20.04, you can always create different pages and gets connected with google account
Priority is not working.
Real Easy to Use for Beginners. Works Like a Charm !
I dont know how to set time. I dont sure if i can set time specific .
Sorting the tasks doesn't work!
I like how it is easy to use with the keyboard. One thing that I wonder about is why that one list cannot be deleted.
summary: Very nice, and easy to use!

description: still test test testing
Love this application, very simple but the functionality to sort does not work.

Do not use with ubuntu-unity-desktop. I tried creating a task, and the unity clock broke. It fixed itself after I deleted the task and refreshed the shell. Unity users, use Evolution Mail and Calendar instead! Otherwise, for other shells, this is a good app.
summary: Don't recommend for users of ubuntu-unity-desktop; otherwise, good

description:
version 3.28.1-5
My archive chats section disappeared. !
Basically it helps me to keep an order on the things I have to do
The app works fine for me so far but it takes time to show new lists that aren't on my computer. Would love a manual re-sync button
summary: Is great and pretty neat but missing manual sync

description: It's very visually appealing, but has some issues. You can make infinite subtasks, but these subtasks won't appear in the "scheduled tasks." Unfortunately most of the plugins don't seem to work either.
برنامه خیلی سبکیه و توصیه میکنم که روی سیستمتون نصبش کنید!
I need to manually set the priority of the task，but unable to re-adjust the order of tasks.
summary: Unable to re-adjust the order of tasks

description: recently from fedora 34 upgrade to 35, the UI becomes better, but it fails me that I cannot type chinese in like before
summary: it cannot type chinese in after upgrade to fedora 35

description:
it doesn't support subtasks
and doesn't show synced tasks in the inbox for some reason.

i have frozen the package to version 3.28, its much more complete.

I wanted to like it, but when I'm in "Inbox" and I choose a due date of the following Monday, the entire application becomes unresponsive. The buttons still animate on mouse over, but I can't click on anything. I can't even close the application without using System Monitor!

I did some testing and I can choose the exact same date in a List I made and it will be fine, but for some reason it will completely lock up the application if I set a date for something in Inbox.

Completely unusable in its current state.
I'd like to have subtasks to make it more organised, if they are I haven't found them yet (I've been using the app for 5 min)
The app seems really good, but it lacks some functionality I reacquire.
summary: It's okay, but doesn't have sub-tasks

description:
Completely and utterly broken in Fedora 35. If the app doesn't crash on startup, it soon soft-crashes afterwards.

In addition, it is impossible to backup the data of the app manually and there is no option to do so either. When the app works, it also seems to forget the tasks put in it.

This is a MASSIVE downgrade from the one in Fedora 34.
Fun to work with

First of all: The report an issue button for the app does not work as it takes to a link that no longer exists.

Lack of dark more is disappointing.

There are menu options that aren't even labelled nor have any text to explain what the button does.

Left-side menu's background is transnparent;thus, making its menu items nearly illegible.
I can't change the order of tasks via drag and drop and schedules get deleted after closing the app
how to run it from cli ?

This program does what it says on the tin. The problem is that it breaks in weird ways.

When you delete an item, it immediately shows back up on your list in case you didn't want to delete it--I get the idea, but that's just terrible.

Sometimes, adding or editing tasks causes the program to crash; there doesn't seem to be a reason why, just that when you go to apply your changes sometimes it just doesn't want it and it throws a fit and crashes.

When you complete a task, a "ghost" of it sticks around at the top as a thin, empty bar which looks like it would otherwise have an item in it UNTIL YOU LOG OUT. If you have a lot of tasks, this gets unwieldy, and you shouldn't have to log out of your system just to have changes to your task list properly and seamlessly applied.

Like GNOME Calendar, it could be awesome--but until the issues plaguing the experience are fixed, it simply won't be.
summary: Does the job, but breaks often

description: i have been using this app for a couple of years now and there are some functions missing like subtasks and inserting links, but what i miss most is a simple search function that allows you to search for words in the item title or the notes
summary: good app, but lacks search function

description: niceeeeeeeee app
good for managing
afasdfsdfsadfasdfsdaf
This used to be so good. Then they changed the interface and removed the ability to manage subtasks. This is a critical, essential feature, and I really hope the Gnome dev team adds it back.
It won't let me reorder tasks to reflect priority. They move and then the content snaps to where it was before. So the app is useless to me.
Does what is says - prio system nice! multiple lists nice feature!
I real like the way it functions its a good app

I've been searchihg for a long time for a digital planner.. I've been coming up with nothing but headaches. This thing fits really good!! I love the way it fetches then displays what's due and whats scheduled and how quick and light it is!! If ONLY it worked with Windows ... I got to have something that works, at work, and this isn't going to "work" at "work" I fear.
Does anybody know of a windows friendly version of this???
I really like the aplicatio. I would say that everything is very clean...
Minimalistic To Do app, which allows you synchronize your tasks with a google. It works quick and responsive.
The only sort order is alphabetical and I need chronological sorting.
It is very helpful for my homework management.
Sometimes it deletes whole lists, sometimes items stay on lists after deleting them, its a toss up. However, I did think it was a good way to start planning feature-wise.

To the reviewer that claims the order of tasks can not be changed: This is not true, you just have to use the built in "priority" method of ording. Use the drop down menu to enter priority data.
I like the color feature which lets me make those things I need to stay hot on red so that I can always deal with the important tasks. Such as tasks which affect other people. Like maybe paying back an IOU I've made the last time I rode with a friend and I ran out of money just before our last round.
summary: This app seems to work well enough for me

description: or better not even a window as it has no titlebar.... only a blanc white square
Nextcloud is a great open source software for syncing files.
Ich mag dieses kleine Helferlein. Es synchronisiert mit Google und funktioniert einfach. "Keep it stupid, keep it simple", genau mein Geschmack :-)
but a has few flaws, once i set a date for a task and the task is synced to google, i cant change the date.

I used to like GNOME ToDo but the recent user interface changes they made are disastrous in my opinion. And for me the latest release 41.0 is just broken and unusable. I wish the app would look like the outdated screenshots provided. It's really sad to see how things went downhill.
summary: Recent user interface changes make it unusable

description:
eine Frauenzeitschrift ist interessanter und man kann dort wenigstens etwas mit anfangen. Die Aufgabenverwaltung macht

nichts

es dauert jetzt keine 3 Minuten mehr und der Horror verschwindet wieder von meiner Platte.
Manchmal bin ich wirklich froh, dass ich einen anständigen Beruf erlernt habe.
summary: ... ich denke ihr wollt mich verarschen

description: man kann die Aufgaben nicht mehr einsehen, wenn man sie erledigt hat. Also schreibt man alle Aufgaben auf das Programm oder man vergisst, dass man etwas gemacht (und abgeschickt) hat.
klappt wie es sein soll! nicht überladen und intuitiv schnell erfasst

Mir fehlt wie überall in Ubuntu, dass man eine Info aufrufen kann in der steht:
1. Programmname, den man auch ins Terminal zum starten eingeben kann.
2. Der Ort wo die Daten und Konfiguration abgespeichert werden.

Das kann man sicher noch ergänzen. 
Die Hasstiraden die zur Zeit soziale Medien überschwemmen, davon sollte man sich nicht beeindrucken lassen.
but became a mess since the last upgrade. crashing all the time.
summary: used to be a gret littler helper

description: Shiny Gnome App, but cant sync with Caldav To-Do´s. Have to use Evolution. Syncing with other Plattforms is essential.
Installiert, gestartet, weißes Fenster ohne Menü, Buttons.... nicht mal eine Titelleiste, um das Fenster zu zu schließen. Nur ein weißes Rechteck. Deinstalliert.
summary: Ein Stern ist noch zu viel

description: Easy to use, great to sync with apple reminders via nextcloud. would be nice to have recurring events one day. thumbs up for the ux.
only white blanc window
Endeavour was working nicely but now with GNOME ToDo I just see a white screen although nextcloud is correctly configured in GOA - this app is thus unusable to me.
Only blanc window under Fedora / GNOME
Just blank window on start
Neither the flatpak nor the native version. I see a blank window thats all.
Funktioniert einwandfrei. Übersichtlich, schnell.....
Overall Good App, works well with Gnome desgin guidelines and syncs automatically with online accounts.
As others already said: black window no functionality on Fedora
mkkookkkkmmhnnhnvxszesedcfghbuj

Es una aplicación muy útil para mirar la lista de tareas que no siempre tienes cubiertas, cuando tienes que hacer varias tareas y lo tienes planificado, o si tienes programado hacer algo en unos días y quieres asegurarte de que no se te pase. Les falta poder enviar la tarea como notificación pero para mi es perfecta.
Me gusta, y mucho. Es simple y eficaz. No hay más que decir.

Cuando quiero mover de posición alguna tarea entre las demás, no funciona el movimiento que estoy solicitando. Se vuelve a regresar a la parte donde estaba. 

He visto que la única manera es agregándole un estatus de "prioridad" para que funcione y este se vaya hasta arriba, pero sólo sería si quiero moverlo hasta arriba.
summary: La interfaz está genial, pero tiene problemas al mover tareas

description:
La aplicacion es muy util, ademas de agregar la posibilidad de sincronizar las cuentas, yo creo que se deberia agregar un boton para sincronizar a mano.
Y un problema que estaba teniendo es lo de agregar una tarea en la cuenta desde la aplicacion.
summary: Me parece muy util la aplicacion

description: es muy practico y sencillo.
Es lo que necesitaba para trabajar cómoda en el escritorio y tener las tareas que creo en el móvil sincronizadas. Sencilla, y eso la hace más productiva.
summary: Muy buena, sencilla y sincroniza con Task de Google a la perfección

description: Me ha facilitado ordenar mi agenda. Se integra con google sin problema. No le encontraba utilidad hasta que se me ocurrió empezar a usarla.
Una aplicacion muy recomendable para guardar las tareas en Ubuntu, ya que encaja muy bien con el estilo de gnome y se sincroniza con las tareas de google tasks.
Funciona bien y se conecta bien con las tareas de google.
no se pueden re ordenar los elementos, no entiendo como una tarea tan básica como esa no puede funcionar bien!!!!!
Super aplicacion. Lo unico malo es que no funciona el ctl+z del resto.

Sencilla y centrada en que apuntes rápidamente una cosa tras otra.
¿Podría ser mejor? Sí, pero esta app ha captado la esencia de lo que debe ser y eso se merece 5 estrellas ya que la inmensa mayoría de apps de tareas no supieron hacer bien lo esencial.
summary: Una aplicación de tareas como debe ser

description: La utilicé por un buen tiempo a satisfacción a pesar de su sencillez; lo cual es una virtud, porque es fácil de usar. Sin embargo, aún no entiendo como se desinstaló y perdí todo cuanto tenia apuntado! Revisé a ver si había quedado alguna carpeta con las notas y citas, pero no conseguí nada. Sería bueno contar con un back-up en estos casos.
summary: Bien, pero sin saber cómo lo perdí todo

description: Apenas lo instalé en Ubuntu 22.04 cargó las tareas programadas.

Desde que se actualizó a Gnome 42 no me ha funcionado o lo hace mal. Y lo digo probándola en Fedora 36 (no funciona), Ubuntu 22.10 (mal y con errores, pero al final funciona) y Manjaro (va mejor pero no como debiera).

Al parecer, por los comentarios que veo, tiene muchos bugs. En mi caso en Debian 11 no puedo asignarles fechas a las tareas sin que se trabe y ya no quiera ni cerrar. Espero lo arreglen porque podría ser muy útil si funcionara bien.
Just a blank window, it doesn't work at all.
Antes funcionaba muy bien pero lleva así como un año
summary: No funciona, solo hay una ventana en blanco

description: Très utile et efficace.

SE: Ubuntu 18.04 LTS 64 bits

Fonctionne parfaitement ! Très utile.
Découvert par hasard : c'est extrêmement simple d'utilisation et fort utile. Merci aux développeurs.
summary: Vraiment pratique et utile. Un grand succès !

description: Ne fonctionne qu'avec les Comptes en Ligne GNOME (GOA), du coup impossible de m'en servir avec ma liste de tâches synchronisées via Mailbox.org. Dommage.

simple et efficace
great app. i recommend this

description: The only option is to completely delete all tasks which is not the behaviour I need. Other functionalies seems fine, but without the function to hide finished tasks, the application is not useful as a todo/task list.

description: Серый экран Федора 39
еще и синкается с гугл делами - вообще огонь
За синхронизацию с гуглом отдельный респект

то что синхронизация с гуглом это хорошо, а что мне мешает зайти на сам сайт ту ду? Я считаю что приложение бомба, но недостаточно реализованного функционала.
Хотелось бы увидеть это добавление задач на рабочий стол, чтобы можно было поверх всех окон включать (было бы идеально) и хотелось бы немного больше редактирвать текст (жирный, курсив, размер)
я много разных перепробовал - этот лучший
Тем не мение, не могу понять, как его синхронизировать с гугл аккаунтом ?

то что пишу в этой проге - появляется в гугле.
НО! то что пишу в гугле - тут не появляется!
более того - если в гугле что то добавил, то прога автоматом обновит гугл по своей записи и то что там добавил удалится.. это конечно никуда не годится((

Сегодня после открытия программы обнаруживаю, что нет задач. Вообще нет не чего. Нет даже листов, не может подключиться к ним. Господин программист немедленно выезжайте ко мне и восстанавливайте данные утерянные по вашей вине!

супер сайт! 
она помогает мне каждый день
то что удаленные задачи не пропадают это позор и ужас

Пропали локальные записи, которые никак с сервисами гугла не должны пересекаться (
А так вроде норм приложение

Приложение класс, простое удобное, за синхронизацию с гуглом - респект! Но если создавать заметку из вкладки "Запланировано", и потом в этой заметке изменить дату, то после перезагрузки ОС дата возвращается обратно((
Не работает программа, выдаёт ошибку при попытке создать первый список.
Убрали возможность скрыть завершенные задачи , верните !

К сожалению сначала ничего не понял, и думал что ничего не работает, а оно действительно не работает. Единственная подсказка указала нажать "+" для создания задачи, и как я на этот единственный доступный плюс в строке ввода не нажимал, он не работает. После третьей переустановки, я понял что тыкать его абсолютно бесполезно и до меня дошло что через "Ввод" возможно добавить задачу
Почему-то не применяется темная тема в версии flatpak вместе с системной темой. А так всё супер
summary: Почему-то не применяется темная тема в версии flatpak

description:
Запустил приложение и оно уже синхронизировалось с моим аккаунтом гугл, в который я вошёл на компьютере. Очень удобно! 
Отличный дизайн, удобный интерфейс. 

Одно НО: отображаются выполненные задачи и скрыть их нельзя. Что мне с ними делать? Удалять по одному?
summary: Синхронизация с gmail отлично работает! Одно но

description: Несмотря на адекватную работу с локальными данными задач, при работе с облачными ресурсами, например с гугл, все не так однозначно
Не работает на Fedora 37, просто серый экран.

Федорино горе 37, старый todo в принципе не взлетел, flatpak версия стартует, но рандомно вылетает. После 3-5 раз за 5 минут снес нафиг. Все равно без интеграции с календарем - все эти таск-менеджеры как пятое колесо - вроде и нужно, и в пути может пригодиться, но специально доставать чтоб покататься...
После установки серый экран, не запускает.
summary: После установки серый экран, не запускает

description:
Ставил на Ubuntu 22.04. Через каждый час примерно крашится, Ubuntu при этом предлагает отправить сообщение о проблеме.
Видимо, проблема случается каждый раз, когда запрашивается синхронизация с учеткой Google
Кроме белого экрана ничего нет

Не норм, что при сбое приложения удалились задачи, котоые писал вчера.

提出几点建议
1:建议增加导出功能,非常急需,或者存在本地某个文件里,不然只能在此设备上看,且如果想发给其它人看根本就不可能
2:设置了时间居然都没有提醒功能?不能结合日历增加一个提醒通知吗??
